website_summaries.verdict: The perfect fin for casual diving and playing along the shore; Wildhorn Topside shoe/fin hybrids are versatile, portable, comfortable, and stylish.
pros: Fitted like shoes, so it’s easy to find your size
Functions as both fin and shoe
Slim and easy to pack for travel
cons: These are great dive fins for surface swimming and beachside fun, not scuba diving or freediving

customer_reviews.title: Best fins out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best fins out there! Can't believe it has taken this long for someone to create a fin that you can actually walk in. I wear a 7.5 and ordered the 7-7.5. The fin fit just a little tight, but when I got them wet, they were perfect! I would not recommend going up a size. The fins have good propelling capabilities, are really easy to walk around on land in, and fit comfortably! They also fit easily in a suitcase, so are a good option to take on vacations! I live on the beach, so lucky for me, these beauties are going to get a lot of use in the coming months.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Parrales

customer_reviews.title: So cute! Perfect for traveling...
customer_reviews.text: These fins are great! We bought them for a backpacking trip to Bali as we planned to do a lot of snorkeling, but also wanted fins that were comfortable and compact. These fins are pretty small, so they fit into our bags pretty well. They are also VERY comfortable and so easy to walk in! My only complaint is that since they are a bit shorter, they don't propel you as far as other fins do.
customer_reviews.author: jdogmtn

customer_reviews.title: Great all around fins!
customer_reviews.text: Great fins! Took them to my local indoor pool to test them out. Compared to my previous compact fins, the whole slip on shoe idea works great! I used no hands and swam belly down and on my back up and down the lane with speed. Felt super comfortable on feet. Also helped the soul is lower than the fins to be able to walk around the pool area without having the fins get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: These are a must have, best design ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are very cool! I cannot wait to try these out, going on a Caribbean Cruise in a month, they will get lots of use. These are so easy to walk in and so incredibly comfortable. I could walk off the boat in them they are that good! Seem to be very well made, and these are going to make snorkeling that much simpler with this design. I wore them around the house and I'm blown away by how simple they are to walk in. Going to make this vacation perfect!
customer_reviews.author: calcrnflakegirl

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sturdy design.
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly comfortable. I was really surprised at how “walkable” these are. The sole is substantial but not too heavy. The boot is a soft neoprene like material and there were no pinch points at all. Really impressed with the build quality and construction. If you are a half size shoe I would order 1/2 size bigger for a comfortable fit (I normally wear a 10.5/11, ordered the 11-11.5 and it’s perfect).
customer_reviews.author: MS.UT

customer_reviews.title: NOT for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: So much potential, but this is NOT the shoe-fin for people with wide feet. I intentionally ordered 12.5" though I wear a 9.5" shoe, yet I could barely fit my feet in them. After 5-10 minutes of using them, the sides of my feet ached so bad I had to take them off for relief. The fins worked, and I really wish they would've fit me (cause they look cool and propelled me) but these just aren't made for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of fins for travel
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of fins for travel. I have regular fins, but they are just too big to take with me on our cruises. These fins work well enough for basic snorkeling, but they are not the greatest fins in the water ... good enough though. They are awesome for walking after you have them on. I would recommend them for snorkeling if you are traveling and packing space is tight. If you are doing scuba, or more serious snorkeling, then get real fins.
customer_reviews.author: MVL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit well and worthless as a fin
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive my fins, but when it came time to actually use them I quickly discovered they do not fit well (very difficult to get on and even harder to remove) and that they are almost completely worthless in providing meaningful forward motion in use. I got the worst leg cramps I have ever had using these, leg cramps so bad I almost cried out for help from people on the shore. I could not remove them in the water, I had to get up on shore and even then it took me nearly 15 minutes to get them off. A big thumbs down from me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Carney

customer_reviews.title: WEll made
customer_reviews.text: They were heavier than a traditional rubber fin because of the fabric. I bought them to avoid the blisters I always get on my feet from fins rubbing on top of feet and toes. Well, I guess the only way to avoid that is to wear neoprene socks, as even with these tight ankle wraps of neoprene, sand still got in and did what sand does best- abrade. So lots of blisters after several hours of snorkeling. They are a bit more difficult to get on, especially once they are wet. They are handy, though, if you have to walk up beach due to rocks or coral. They are fairly easy to walk in, unlike most flippers.
customer_reviews.author: Comaha

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, fill with water, heavy, painful. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Awful awful awful! Do not buy these unless you want a 5-pound weight on each foot that fills with water and drags your feet down, puts torque on your knees and halves your swimming time. They are so badly designed - no holes for water to drain out of so they fill with water that has nowhere to go. Like trying to swim with work boots on. I managed four lengths before I took them off and finished my hour swim with nothing on my feet. Next day I was limping with the injury to my left knee which took the rest of the week to stop hurting. I strongly advise you not to use these flippers.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual snorkling
customer_reviews.text: Once I got them on they were great! I have a high arch so getting into these is very difficult and took a lot of time. These would be better if they had some time of zipper or velcro closure going up the inside of the boot. Once they were on they worked great, the shoe size is perfect. They worked exactly as described and are easy to walk in, just very difficult to get into if you have a high arch. I really did love them once they were on and they go perfect with my neon yellow mask!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: These Wildhorn Topside Snorkel Fins purchased through Amazon are an answer to prayer. I have Rheumatoid Arthritis making the standard sized conventional fins impossible to maneuver. These fins are lightweight and make swimming and snorkeling very easy on the ankles and knees. Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and good looking crap. DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Totally useless as FINS in the water. Good only for proud walks on the sand. BUT NO THRUST in the water. More like 0.5 on 10 scale. Tried hard during resent Caribbean vacation. Returning as useless.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: These flippers are only useful in very calm water like a pool
customer_reviews.text: Went to snorkel with these and they didn't provide any thrust. I had a panic attack and had to swim quickly back to shore while there was a family of three with a young child that all had regular length flippers that were able to snorkel for 30 minutes. I've been snorkeling in the exact same water for over 4 years at least a dozen times so it's definitely not me it's the flippers. These flippers are only useful in very calm water like a pool. They should say this in the description "Only for use in very calm water and not intended for use in any wavy or choppy water."
customer_reviews.author: Charles Pait

customer_reviews.title: Poor propelling force in water
customer_reviews.text: One star only because the idea is great to have harder sole for snorkeling rocky areas. But function is extremely poor. Fins too short and inflexible to be effective. Felt like legs has to work harder but we weren’t moving in the water. Also, while very comfortable, very hard to get on and off while wet.
customer_reviews.author: Sherryle  Givens

customer_reviews.title: Great fit - no blisters
customer_reviews.text: I used these in Hawaii and they worked great. No Blisters- which I usually get when using fins. Speed is slower than long fins but they do help a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Companion on the Beach, Swimming or Snorkling and in the GYM Pool !
customer_reviews.text: The Perfect companion for you Water Activities - Snorkeling, Swimming and Walking on the Beach. Short Enough that you do not have to walk like a Penguin, Comfortable for hours of continuous wearing and use. Great for you Swimming Laps in the Pool. I recommend these over any type of Fin for Snorkeling. I'm ordering two more, another set for me and one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: great as shoes, so-so as actual flippers
customer_reviews.text: These are really interesting and fun. They're really a pair of nice comfortable durable "water shoes", with mini fins attached to the front. For walking on rocky beaches and in rocky shallow water, they're great. For kicking around and snorkelling in a limited area, they're not nearly as powerful as full size fins nor even "travel fins", but they do add some propulsion beyond just no fins at all, so that's good enough for my purposes. And being so short, the fins let you stand and walk relatively easily, in shallow water, which is the main attraction for them in our case (snorkelling in a small very rocky sheltered bay).
customer_reviews.author: ckk

customer_reviews.title: Great fins! Awesome brand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my wife, I’ve snorkeled and spend a lot of time in the ocean, but for her it was all new. These fins make entering and exiting the water much easier for her. They stayed on relatively well, but with her small stature I needed to do some additional Velcro work upon returning from the Cook Islands. She moved fluidly through the water without working harder than needed. We also have the Wildhorn towels and wildhorn giant beach blanket, their products are well made, priced well, and super functional.
customer_reviews.author: DrExploreMore

customer_reviews.title: Walk backwards!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for their small size to use with snorkel off the beach on a Caribbean cruise. They fit quite snugly but do the job once on the water. Word of caution... they are so easy to walk in on level ground that you might think you can just walk into heavy surf forwards. Like I discovered, you can get tripped up this way and get a bad case of skinned up knees! Once past the breaking waves, they work pretty darned good!
customer_reviews.author: N. Burles

customer_reviews.title: I am a size 8 and mine fits perfect, however my hubby is a 10 or 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 8 and mine fits perfect, however my hubby is a 10 or 10 and a half and I had to return his for a size 11. I bought mine through Amazon and his from another retailer and had no problem with the return, great costumer service from Wildhorn company. Very comfortable, really looking forward to using them on my next snorkeling trip as I believe we will have no problems with it hurting the back of our feet as many flippers would. Also the easy mobility on walking on these and the size (easy to pack on suitcase) are a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Williams

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of these fins
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these fins. they fit just right and were comfy. the only thing I didn't like (which lead to returning them) was that they make your feet float to much. I got these to use when I go snorkeling, scalloping, lobstering all things where you are swimming on the surface of the water and I didn't really want to use my big dive fins. Because they make your feel float I had to actively try to keep my feet just under the water surface to be able to kick. After a day on the water that just got to be to much.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: We tried them in Jamaica and hated them. They are difficult to put on and harder to get off. They stay on your feet well though. The current we were snorkeling in, these shorter flippers didn't work well. I wanted to return them but the window for returns was up before we went on vacay. Very disappointed with this purchase. Now I'm stuck with two pairs of them. Great concept but they need zippers on the back for easier on/off wear.
customer_reviews.author: MomZ4

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is Confusing, Why?
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I love the concept and execution of this combo flipper-shoe. Problem is they seem to have trouble in determining the size. The one I got seemed to have been sized for a woman's foot and thus too narrow. Asked for further explanation, but nothing yet. Look at their sizing chart: it's a mess. And the size on the box I received was different from what was on the shoe. Argh.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, but not much propulsion
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the most stylish fins for goofing around in. They are very comfortable and easy to walk in. I used them in beach sand and while river boarding. If you want a water shoe you can kind of swim in, get these. If you want to go snorkling or open water swim...anything actually athletic...don't buy these. The fins do not provide much thrust. I swim faster and easier without them.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Functionality
customer_reviews.text: The fit was fairly accurate and comfortable but the functionality was not what I expected. While the fins do float as advertised, I feel that they are too buoyant which causes them to be difficult to use for swimming laps. They tend to make it harder for various swim strokes kicking ability because they keep your feet on the surface. This is only my opinion after trying them out for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Archuleta

customer_reviews.title: Does not work:( terrible product:(
customer_reviews.text: These are great for walking around on dry ground. Less than useless trying to swim with them:( I tried to use these but because of the angle of the fins it is pretty much impossible to swim with these. I had to take them off to snorkel:(
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Not functional but great concept
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my trip to Roatan Honduras. Expecting great things! (Two stars only for the fins because the idea is great. )I like the fact you have harder soles for snorkeling rocky areas. But function is extremely poor. The fins were too short and inflexible to be effective. Felt like my legs had to work way too much, without making any headway in the water. It was not a relaxing time what so ever. I used them one time - threw them back into my suitcase. Luckily I had also packed my split fins ... Four stars because of the amazing customer service!!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Quigley

customer_reviews.title: No thrust, difficult to don
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased these for open water lake swimming and snorkeling. He found it very difficult to don and remove them as there is no zipper. He was able to walk in them, however the fins have no thrust (less than his pool exercise fins) so were not suitable for open water swimming and snorkeling and totally unsuitable for shallow free dives.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: compact but thrust suffers in current
customer_reviews.text: These are what they say they are "compact travel" fins. They are comfortable with the neoprene booties built in and they are easy to walk on when not swimming. A little slow to get on and off when wet compared to my rubber fins. Unfortunately they suffer from the compact nature of the actual fin which is rather duck like. They don't have the in water thrust of even a cheap pair of rental fins. In strong current I felt that I was struggling at times. Nice idea but I will return to full size fins in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Olson

customer_reviews.title: and these things are so fun! Obviously the whole idea of these fins is ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these swim fins and tried them out at a near by lake, and these things are so fun! Obviously the whole idea of these fins is to be able to walk in and out of the water with ease and to provide a more comfortable fit, so I tried running around in these and even rock hopping across a stream and these things are so easy to maneuver in. walking in them is a breeze and I honestly think its easier to run in them. I highly recommend these fins. They run pretty true to size so if you are in between sizes I would definitely go up!
customer_reviews.author: sunstonephotos

customer_reviews.title: Fins aren't great
customer_reviews.text: I gave this review 3 starts because I didn't want to give it less. The mask worked fine, just was too big for me. Fortunately, it fits my husband fine, and worked as it was supposed to. The fins, however, don't propel nearly as well as traditional fins. The ankle part works fine, and the ability to walk on the sand is also good. But that's not why we buy fins! The actual fin is short so just doesn't do a good job. I would recommend the mask, but not the fins.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid B.

customer_reviews.title: Love the IDEA of these, but...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like these. However, the are very rigid and made my foot sore. This was due to the firmness of the sole in conjunction with the short blade. Being able to easy walk was nice, but you sacrifice A LOT in their intended use as snorkeling fins. Lots of of foot fatigue from the extra effort to kick and added weight. I don’t recommend these, especially given the high price tag, considering I’m currently shopping for new snorkel fins for vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Good item, annoying Velcro
customer_reviews.text: These fins are awesome. I am an amature free-diver and I really like these fins. The only problem I have with them is that the Velcro straps do not stay velcroed in the water very well; I was having this issue the first time I used them. I luckily got a size just right so I do not need the velcro for comfort or tightness. I had to constantly strap them back together while swimming. I rather wish they'd use a clip or something other than Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Auston Duke Hafen

customer_reviews.title: Although the fit was nice & snug about the ankle
customer_reviews.text: The reviews said these were tight fitting so I knew I was pushing my luck when I ordered them hoping that the 12.5 size might fit my 12.5 foot. No luck. Although the fit was nice & snug about the ankle, my toes were hopelessly crushed against the front of the fin making them impossible for me to use. The quality of the fins seems great and I was REALLY hoping that they would work out. If so many people are saying the sizing is small, why can't Wildhorn A) size them accurately and B) sell sizes up to 15 ? It seems like the demand is there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had too much trouble getting them on
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these specifically to snorkel on an island trip. Totally struggled to put these on. They were sized correctly but getting them on my very normal 10D feet was a major project. It wasn't so much the actual fit once it was on, it was stretching the neoprene over my instep to get them on. I probably will not use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Ventura

customer_reviews.title: Not effective against a current
customer_reviews.text: Positive: great size for traveling, very comfortable, much easier to walk around in than regular snorkel fins. Negative: the small size means they are ineffective at generating forward motion in anything beyond a moderate current. They are fine in sheltered areas but if you expect to be swimming against any kind of current then I would recommend buying a larger set of snorkel fins. Mine are staying here in raja ampat, Indonesia and not making their way back to the US
customer_reviews.author: STM

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are comfy, lightweight and the velcro band allows for perfect adjustment. Used these snorkeling in Hawaii and they were easy to put on and walk into the water without tripping. They require a little more work kicking in the water than regular, longer flippers, but worked just fine all in all.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beach walks.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent for walking on the beach. The neoprene is not too tight or sticky to get on, but keeps suctions down for a good fit. Stroke is a little looser than most fins, but walking is way too convenient. Totally worth it. I debated whether to get them for a while, but wish I had bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: He says they give his legs a good workout in the pool
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and the reviews or the product description said to buy one size larger than the shoe size so I did and my husband loves using these in the pool. He says they give his legs a good workout in the pool. Plus he can walk in the pool with them on. Most of the other fins I looked at didn't have the "shoe" part. These were the only ones like this and I got them for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Willis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for shallow or near land snorkeling!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for shallow or near the land snorkeling. Not enough propulsion for deeper dives. Bought them because I simply didn’t want to carry my fins. You can walk in these indeed! Reason for 4/5 stars: Velcro buckle gets undone when in the water. These are sock like fitting, so you do not necessarily need to have them tightened, just annoying to come out of the water with velcro drugging alongside.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: I had originally ordered a size up but had the greatest customer service to get the correct size
customer_reviews.text: These fins fit just as sized for the women's sizing. I had originally ordered a size up but had the greatest customer service to get the correct size. No questions asked they just helped me to switch out sizes as quickly as possible. Seriously, the best customer service. Fins fit perfectly and work great in the water! Took them to sand hollow for an open water swim and it was so nice to have the booty when walking into the water on all the hard rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Dan A

customer_reviews.title: great for Rocky beaches, solid fins
customer_reviews.text: solid fins setup, like the neoprene sleeve, tight fit for sure like it says, gets very comfortable in the water. my set the velcro straps kept coming open in the water, not sure if I'm bumping the fins together when swimming or what, I did use kick more than frogs, maybe that is my issue. other than that I found them very comfortable, and nice propulsion while snorkeling in Maui. got alot of mileage out them! very much liked the grippy hiking sole when entering the water from Maui jagged lava rock beaches! big plus
customer_reviews.author: Ted Colarusso

customer_reviews.title: Snorkel dorkely awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am a solid 9 bout the 9.5-10.5, I think or 9-10. Eitherway, toes touched the end but was ok since they didnt while snorkling BUT i would order up if you're anything bigger than a 9. . I love these. Much more streamlined so they werent so awkward as long fins. Greact to travel with and fantastic extra ankle support. I did a lot of research, so Ill save you the time, buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable but just as powerful as the best
customer_reviews.text: Love these fins. I am an avid body boarder and this fins are great. I have some Churchill fins that are great, but very uncomfortable. These give me the same force per kick but don't wear on my ankle. Plus these are easier to walk in and I can put them on, on the beach and not get sand in them. No more putting fins on in the whitewater getting pushed around or putting fins on in the sand only to have sand get in them. I love these fins and won't go back.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fins!
customer_reviews.text: We went to Jamaica with these fins for snorkeling. They were great! My size wasn't available yet, so I had to wear my husbands (one size larger than mine). Even though they were larger, they fit with no problems. I could walk easily with them on. And in the water, they were very comfortable, like I wasn't wearing any fins at all! They gave me the extra power to my kicks to keep my position despite the rough waves. Everyone who saw these marveled and asked where I got them from. Wildhorn might have some more orders coming in from Jamaica!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love our fins
customer_reviews.text: We go to the ocean once a year. We love to fish/spearfish in lakes. My kids are 13-15-18 and they hate my big scuba fins. These fins are perfect for my kids and their casual snorkeling. They are easy to put on. They can walk somewhat in them when we fly they are much easier to pack. If you like/love to snorkel these fins are great. I also bought two of their full fac snorkel mask and we love them. If you haven’t seen them take s minute and check them out. The come with a GoPro mount.
customer_reviews.author: alicia Kinne

customer_reviews.title: Returning Fins they don't work as described
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these fins I didn't realize the return policy had such a small window of return. We just got back from our cruise and didn't have the opportunity to try them out sooner, in order to see if they failed their performance or not. Please consider allowing us to return them based on our situation. I had to have a spinal operation and had to put our trip off for a later day. This is my second review and still waiting for my refund. The fins were returned months ago, because they do not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Davis

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable and lightweight. Purchased these for some upcoming travel. I hate renting snorkel equipment, because often it is more expensive than buying. Regular snorkel fins are so big and heavy, so this should make packing everything into a single suitcase easier. Also like that I can walk like a normal person with these on. Well done, Wildhorn!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Indablank

customer_reviews.title: These fins are really easy to put on and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These fins are really easy to put on and are very comfortable. It is so nice to be able to easily walk around the beach while wearing the fins. I have noticed that you do need to keep the straps pretty tight to help avoid getting medium pieces of sand and rocks into your boot. This mostly happens as you are entering or exiting the water. Great Product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not very efficient for swimming
customer_reviews.text: The are comfortable and compact, however, not very good for swimming laps, they felt a little heavy. I would prefer the blades to be a little longer for swimming. For boggie boarding, where you need a short fin, they are good, and they are easy to walk in.
customer_reviews.author: tigershark

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Propell You Though The Water!
customer_reviews.text: i bought two pairs for our trip to Florida for Labor Day. Sad to say, while you can walk in them and they do float great, They do NOT work well cutting through the water. My husband said they help about 10%. Sad to say, it is too late to return them but we will definitely need to buy a different pair😝
customer_reviews.author: Diana C.

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, but great otherwise!
customer_reviews.text: These do fit a little small, but that is my ONLY complaint! I really like how they feel in the water and that there is a grippy shoe to protect my feet. Feet take so long to heal when they are cut up. I like the shorter fin because it is easier to navigate in the water. I go the white with blue and they are SUPER cute! Please get your size like you would buy a Nike shoe. (Go big as they run small) Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina K

customer_reviews.title: This is the coolest dive fin you can ask for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest dive fin you can ask for! Part shoe part fin you can and I have walked into the surf without the usual awkward fin dance trying to kee you balance and go int the water ! Get your pair as soon as you can you will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: M.E

customer_reviews.title: Packaged with miss-matched fin size
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I ordered these and had them sent to my vacation stop over point so I would have them in the Florida Keys. When they arrived, They were professionally packaged in a box sized 13 men’s, which was the size I ordered. When I opened the box, one was a size 12 and one was a 13. Sadly now I won’t have fins for my trip. This is obviously a manufacturer packaging error...but sucks for as well as the items were packaged in their display box, if expect someone would be looking at the size tags from a quality perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Calban

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my experience with them so far
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my experience with them so far! The rubber of the soles and the fins feel of good enough quality they'll be perfect for what I wanted them for; versatility for snorkeling, so much easier to pack than full size fins, and not nearly as awkward as full size fins entering and leaving the water (granted, I'm not a veteran snorkeler so maybe my awkwardness was to be expected.) In any case, I much prefer these.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great travel fins.
customer_reviews.text: Great travel fins, easy to pack and transport. I have snorkeled in California, Mexico, Hawaii, the Great Barrier Reef and Fiji. These fins are perfect for travel. I like the short fin and find them perfect for leisurely surface snorkeling. They are also perfect for reef snorkeling. The booty fit is comfortable and practical.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and just right for travel.
customer_reviews.text: I just took mine out for their first swim. These are really comfortable. Men’s size 12 fits true to size. They are a little snug to put on, but fit great. They are easy to walk on dry ground with. The amount of propulsion you get with each kick is appropriate for the short fin size. The neoprene is buoyant, so your feet will want to float toward the surface. That didn’t really seem to affect performance when diving down deeper. They were a little tougher to get off than they were to get on, but it wasn’t a problem. Overall, I’m really glad I bought these for travel snorkeling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No motion
customer_reviews.text: These may be great for traveling, light weight and comfortable but they are horrible for snorkeling. They are simply too short to give you any power in the water and making it impossible to dive under. If you simple want to float around in the water then they are fine but if you indeed to actually snorkel and explore, go with the traditional large fins.
customer_reviews.author: MACS Industrial Supplies

customer_reviews.title: Just slip on and Go!
customer_reviews.text: You need these, no more tripping over myself to go in the water, great fit! I am a womens USA 9 in my sneakers. This fits like a glove, or a flipper in this case lol. I'm so glad I do not have to worry about the buckles breaking when traveling because there are none!
customer_reviews.author: My Mother Ship

customer_reviews.title: Wildhorn Topside Snorkel Fins
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for snorkeling. They fit perfectly and fit easily in my suitcase for travel. In stead of fighting with trying to put on fins at the beach and stumble into the water, I put these on like tennis shoes and walk into the surf. The fins have adequate propulsion to get around the reefs. Very useful if one has to walk over rocks in shallow water.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: Good fins you can walk in.
customer_reviews.text: Being of the older persuasion and not very flexible, I was in search of fins that Were usable forc walking, diving snd snorkeling. Putting fins on in the water is difficult and embarrassing. These fins fit the bill. I can put them on and comfortably walk to the water. In the water they are as good as any and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sogg

customer_reviews.title: High quality, compact fins for recreational snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: While compact and small making it easier to carry while traveling, the fins are high quality and well suited to recreational snorkeling and swimming. The fins have a snug fit, so please review recommendations from vendor and users on how to select the right size before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer1

customer_reviews.title: Love em!  Great Idea.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an upcoming cruise to the Caribbean. They arrived today. I wear a women's 10 and I have a wide foot. I bought the Mens 10 and they fit perfect. Can't wait to try them out. Wore them around the house and they're not only comfortable, they're easy to walk around in. Can't wait to put them to the test. My husband wants a pair but he would need a Men's 13. Hopefully you'll start making bigger sizes. Quality looks to be very good.
customer_reviews.author: MorningGlory

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: The fins are rather stiff therefore hard on one's ankles. They very difficult to put on. I bought size 6 and had a hard time helping my niece with 5.5 shoe size to put them on. I tried them on myself and it was a hassle. I will keep them but would not buy them again. Next time I will definatelly return to my trusted Head fins.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Best compact fins
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these fins!! Took them with me on a trip to Belize. It fit perfectly in my 55L backpacking bag along with clothes and my snorkel set. I used these fins for cave tubing! We hiked a 45 min trail and crossed three rivers. No problems at all and everyone was jealous! Don’t hesitate and buy it. Also great for areas with a lot of reef or rocks. In and out of the water with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: My son puts them on in the water and they go on just fine. They are supposed to be snug so they ...
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these for his swim team as they are encouraged to use fins on Fridays. He loves them as they have more personality and look "cooler" than some of the more plain fins that his peers have. Some reviewers have complained that they fit too tight. My son puts them on in the water and they go on just fine. They are supposed to be snug so they don't come off in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great travel fins!
customer_reviews.text: My new fins arrived last week and they are exactly what expected. I was able to walk around the house in them without tripping and I’m sure they will perform the same way on sand and boat decks. They offer enough protection to walk on rocks getting in and out of the water from the beach. are sturdy enough for walking
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: They look great! They feel great! They float!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for some easy snorkeling at SoCal beaches. The shoe-like soles make them easy to walk in, and very comfortable. The neoprene keeps your feet warm in cool water. The only thing NOT great about them is their buoyancy. Because they float, it's hard to descend in them. I couldn't even keep my legs below the surface when kicking. Other than this, I Really like them.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mantel

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea
customer_reviews.text: These fins work well for walking on a rocky beach and getting in and out of the water. Great job there. I did not care for their performance in the water however. They tended to make my feet float and had an awkward feel to them when kicking. For occasional use I would recommend them, but for serious snorkeling, I would stick with a swim fin. They are well made
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't even bother trying these.
customer_reviews.text: We bought two adult sets for a Caribbean vacation. Our children already had normal swim fins. Neither adult could keep up with our kids using these fins. They absolutely give no propulsion in water.
customer_reviews.author: CandyB

customer_reviews.title: Barely work as fins, Velcro worthless. Good for fins
customer_reviews.text: They work ok in the water, you can walk in them which is nice. Velcro strap is worthless. They come loose snorkeling after 5 minutes. Will likely cut them off so they aren't bugging me in the water. Not worth the price I would say...
customer_reviews.author: Erik California

customer_reviews.title: I recommend you skip these
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I recommend you skip these. Used mine for a week of snorkeling in Hawaii. They were heavy, gave next to nothing in terms of acceleration and control. Also annoying to get on and off, and uncomfortable in the water. Cool idea, but it needs revising.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mustard

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these travel fins for snorkeling excursions on a cruise we went on in January and they fit like a glove - literally and were perfect - the size was perfect for travel/packing and they performed better than I had hoped/imagined. I would absolutely recommend them. (Note: My husband had purchased different fins and wished he had gotten the same as mine!)
customer_reviews.author: Carla O'Gwin

customer_reviews.title: Love the way they fit at the heal and ankle.
customer_reviews.text: Sizes listed are wrong. Just bought these flippers. This is what we have been looking for a VERY long time. Love the way they fit at the heal and ankle. My shoe size is 9-9.5 so I got a men’s size 10, but it was a very tight fit; too tight. My wife tried them on and they fit her perfectly; she is a women’s size 8-8.5. I bought another pair size 11 for me. Hope they fit well!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Lapke

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size larger than my shoe size, though they do run true to size. I find them much easier to put on and off. Also, the bott holds them on and my toes can move inside, so no cramping. I found these allow me to swim with better body alignment. The ability to walk around out of water allows me to get out of the pool to get something without having to remove them. I love the short finS.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stowell

customer_reviews.title: Nice product -- good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The rubber soles are awesome for walking around and the shorter fins don't make you feel like you have clown feet when walking outside the water. The wet suit material is high quality and also keeps your feet warm. And the adjustable strap creates the perfect fit. I normally wear size 10.5 in mens and the 10 fit great -- once wet.
customer_reviews.author: johnythunder

customer_reviews.title: I snorkel a lot (not a beginner) I had a pair of Neo Fin similar that it had a soft neoprene material but wasn't like a shoe
customer_reviews.text: I regret getting these fins...I snorkel a lot (not a beginner) I had a pair of Neo Fin similar that it had a soft neoprene material but wasn't like a shoe...when snorkeling with these pair....I just could not get the propulsion needed to dive down.....In fact I wouldn't count on these to work trying to fight a current that we have here on the Northshore...these are okay for the pool...
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Myers

customer_reviews.title: Would rather save the money and walk backwards into the water.
customer_reviews.text: These feel great to wear to and from the water and really protect your feet. Unfortunately, the shape of them make them awkward to pack and the constraints of the ankles prevent a natural kick in the water. They also felt so buoyant that it was a challenge to get my feet below the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Golightly

customer_reviews.title: Very little help when trying to swim in water
customer_reviews.text: Fins work well for walking. Actually using them in the water the fins to be on the short side as far as pain really useful. They do help but not a whole lot. It would NOT buy them again. They are Extremely comfortable but the Velcro on the fin keeps coming loose as you try to swim.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis H

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: I went to south America to a beach shore. The first time I put the Fins, the strap broke. i could not even use it one time. The plastic strap is really weak. I left the Fins in my beach house as a decoration. Ale
customer_reviews.author: Ale

customer_reviews.title: Great job with these!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! The fit is definitely true to size. I where a size seven and that is what I ordered. They are very comfortable. And yes you can walk in them! I am a scuba instructor and this has changed my view on snorkeling. They don't cause leg cramping, yeah! I packed them in a backpack and they fit. If I'm only talking snorkeling gear these make it much easier...you don't have to pack big fins and Booties, they are all in one. I would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila hutton

customer_reviews.title: rubber is solid and the neoprene makes them very comfortable! the sizing is good just be aware that ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the quality of these, rubber is solid and the neoprene makes them very comfortable! the sizing is good just be aware that the top end of the range is the full size of the foot bed so if you are on the border your toes will be at the end.
customer_reviews.author: justin lang

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! My son loves them, they are stretchy and have a good strap so even though they are a men's size 12 almost everyone in my family can use them. He can walk around in them easily and they are very strong and pliable so I'm not worried about the fin splitting or cracking when he walks around. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Rb

customer_reviews.title: My favorite new necessary toys!
customer_reviews.text: These rock! The fit was great and the comfort was exceptional. I can’t say enough about these fins with this amount of characters. So just to say the price is far too low for such exceptional quality and function. Not to mention, they’re pretty darn stylish as well. Get ‘em or suffer with uncool non functional fins. Word!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey English

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. Do not recommend for swimming/snorkeling.
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped these would be light weight and flexible for snorkeling and long swims. But they were not at all. They were heave, like concrete blocks. They hindered my swim/snorkel to the point that I felt like I was exhausted. I was so disappointed. I actually took them on a trip and left them there on the island as a freebie because I didn't like them at all. I don't recommend. I felt like I was going to drown with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Definitely won't propel you as fast or far as longer fins, so keep that in mind. Easy to use, comfortable, cute. Normally wear a 7.5 women's, got the 7 and fit perfect as they stretch just a bit more specially in water.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Solid, comfortable and functional in the water.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable but a bit difficult for me to put on. I have been using them for lap swimming but will go back to normal "burners" and keep these for the beach. As advertised they are surprisingly easy to walk in. Travel? They are a bit heavy but would be worth taking if not hitting many destinations.
customer_reviews.author: Smardt

customer_reviews.title: These are the best beach fins you could ask for
customer_reviews.text: These are the best beach fins you could ask for. Able to walk in them and great for snorkeling around in the water. Used on our trip to Hawaii and made the experience more enjoyable since we could easily carry them or store in the vehicle while we drove to the next beach to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry L Proudfoot

customer_reviews.title: These flippers are awesome! I'd never ordered any before but started using ...
customer_reviews.text: These flippers are awesome! I'd never ordered any before but started using in the pool this week for added strength and to get familiar before heading to the turquoise waters next month. The fit like a dream are SO comfortable and no hurting, digging, rubbing at all. I give these a darn "10"!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hurts to swim
customer_reviews.text: Not only did they fit smaller than expected, but once we got the right size, these things hurt so bad you can't even use it. It was a number. We wanted to use them for snorkeling but really can swim with them. They hurt.
customer_reviews.author: S.Kim

customer_reviews.title: You won't believe these fins!
customer_reviews.text: These are TRANSFORMATIONAL swim fins. As a swimmer and snorkeler I've used many varities, but these are SO COMFORTABLE that you can walk with them while still getting great power. Get them while you can.
customer_reviews.author: P. F Tittl

customer_reviews.title: More cons than pros for me....
customer_reviews.text: Would have been better if they had a zipper on side to help when putting on/taking off. Also, while I get they are compact for travel, they were just too short to really propel you in the ocean. Ended up renting fins from the resort for the rest of the trip. On a positive note, they were easy to walk in so that was a plus when entering water from beach rather than a boat.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy C.

customer_reviews.title: This snorkle fins are great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a scuba diver in the past so I know what great fins are. These are not for serious diving! They work great for walking on the rocks at the beach then swimming. They protect your feet from injuries and help swim a little. Easy to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny Cat

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME... Best fins ever
customer_reviews.text: These are truly the BEST flippers I have worn. I bought a pair for my wife and I just before our trip to Antigua. They are compact yet very efficient in the water. The capability to walk in them is amazing. We love them and hope to wear them out over the next couple years. I did find that I needed to err on the size larger. I originally bought the size I would normally wear and returned them with no problem for the next size larger. The larger size was perfect
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fear

customer_reviews.title: These fins are definitely easy to walk in
customer_reviews.text: My Topside fins arrived the other day and I'm so excited for my next snorkeling vacation. These fins are definitely easy to walk in, and I really like the idea of the built in sock/boot, as I find separate fin socks to be uncomfortable. The fins are a couple inches shorter than my Cressi "travel fins", so easier to pack as well. Combined with the SeaView snorkel, I feel like I have quality snorkeling gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: These fins are so nice and the quality is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These fins are so nice and the quality is fantastic, me and my wife use them for snorkeling we chose these because it’s a boot/short fin and it’s easy to walk or run in them, we have little guys snorkeling with us so it’s a wise joice to wear these Incase you have to stand or react quickly. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hanford

customer_reviews.title: ... reason for the return was that although one could easily walk froward into the water the flippers for surface ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't see the sizing reference between US / CDN but the main reason for the return was that although one could easily walk froward into the water the flippers for surface snorkelling did not seem to work well ... a lot more effort was required
customer_reviews.author: Bob Walsh

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got them
customer_reviews.text: When I saw these fins, I was really intrigued by the walk-ability of them. So glad I got them! They do not provide the same "kick" as a full length fin so don't expect that but I got what I needed in compactness and again, the ability to easily put them on and walk straight to the water without looking like a blue footed booby! Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The flippers are very comfortable and so much better than regular flippers. I usually get blisters from them. While they are shorter than usual...so be aware you will no travel as quickly or easily as longer fins. For short snorkeling trips they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Roxana Kessler

product_meta.title: Wildhorn Topside Snorkel Fins- Compact Travel, Swim, and Snorkeling Flippers for Men and Women. Revolutionary Comfort on Land and Sea.
feature_bullets: IMPORTANT SIZING INFORMATION - We have recently updated our sizing so in most cases Topside snorkel fins fit true to size; however, please review sizing chart in the images to ensure you pick the correct fins size.

COMFORT - Topside fins fit like a shoe. No more blisters as you happily spend as much time as you want swimming, snorkeling, body boarding, or paddle boarding. The closed toe and heel prevent cramping and hypertension in your foot. Each fin has an adjustable Velcro strap around the ankle to provide further support. The neoprene boot allows for flexibility in sizing as the material has some stretch.

VERSATILITY- We combine the function of both shoe and fin. Walk around land comfortably. No more awkward waddling in and out of the water. Easier to wear than most other fins. You will have more foot protection as each fin has a strong rubber sole. Additional uses for Topside fins include body boarding, paddle boarding, and river boarding.

THRUST - While longer fins will provide more thrust for applications like diving, these short blade fins will provide noticeable boost to your swimming. This design has a stronger down kick than up due to the primary fin surface on top of the boot. For extended swims and deeper dives, we recommend you choose fins with longer blades. For casual snorkeling and shorter distance swimming a short blade fin will help with improving strength while providing needed thrust to get the job done.

TRAVEL READY- A pair of Topside fins will fit easily into a carry-on or backpack. No need to suffer through low quality rental gear. Our swim fins also float. Drag from the rest of your body is reduced by the buoyancy of the fins lifting your legs in the water. They'll also never be lost to Davy Jones' locker.
